concert.name: concert
concert.description:
The 'concert' table contains information about concerts held at various venues. Each row represents a concert event. The table includes the following columns:

- concert_id: Unique identifier for each concert event.

- venue_id: Identifier for the venue where the concert is held.

- concert_date: Date on which the concert is held.

- concert_time: Time at which the concert starts.

- artist_id: Identifier for the artist or band performing at the concert.

- genre: Genre of music performed at the concert.

- ticket_price: Price of each ticket.

concert_ID.name: concert_ID
concert_ID.description: Unique identifier for each concert.  This column is also a foriegn key reference in 'singer_in_concert' table

Stadium_ID.name: Stadium_ID
Stadium_ID.description: ID of the stadium where the concert is held.  This is one of the primary key in the 'stadium' field

Year.name: Year
Year.description: Year in which the concert is held

singer.name: singer
singer.description:
The 'singer' table contains information about singers. Each row represents a singer and includes the following columns:

- SingerId: Unique identifier for each singer.
- Name: Name of the singer.
- Genre: Genre of music the singer is associated with.
- Age: Age of the singer.
- Gender: Gender of the singer.
- RecordLabel: Record label the singer is signed to.
- Awards: Number of awards the singer has won.
- NetWorth: Estimated net worth of the singer.

Country.name: Country
Country.description: Country of origin for the singer.

Song_Name.name: Song_Name
Song_Name.description: Name of the song sung by the singer.

Song_release_year.name: Song_release_year
Song_release_year.description: Year in which the song was released.

Is_male.name: Is_male
Is_male.description: Boolean value indicating the gender of the singer (True for male, False for female).

singer_in_concert.name: singer_in_concert
singer_in_concert.description:
The 'singer_in_concert' table contains information about singers and their concerts. Each row represents a unique concert event. The table includes the following columns:

- concert_id: Unique identifier for each concert event.
- singer_id: Unique identifier for each singer.

concert_ID.name: concert_ID
concert_ID.description: Unique identifier for each concert. This is primary key of 'concert' table

Singer_ID.name: Singer_ID
Singer_ID.description: Unique identifier for each singer. This is primary key of 'singer' table

stadium.name: stadium
stadium.description:
The 'stadium' table contains information about various stadiums around the world. Each row in the table represents a single stadium. The table includes the following columns:

- StadiumID: A unique identifier for each stadium.
- StadiumName: The name of the stadium.
- City: The city where the stadium is located.
- Country: The country where the stadium is located.
- Capacity: The maximum number of people that the stadium can hold.
- Highest: The highest recorded attendance at the stadium
- Lowest: The lowest recorded attendance at the stadium.
- Average: Average attendance recorded at the stadium.

Location.name: Location
Location.description: City and state where the stadium is located

Capacity.name: Capacity
Capacity.description: Total number of spectators the stadium can accommodate

Highest.name: Highest
Highest.description: Highest attendance recorded at the stadium

Lowest.name: Lowest
Lowest.description: Lowest attendance recorded at the stadium

Average.name: Average
Average.description: Average attendance for all the matches played at the stadium
